understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method called getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() which simply returns a static variable indexSummaryCapacityInMB.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration parameter 'indexSummaryCapacityInMB' which represents the fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. The method getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() is used to retrieve this configuration value.

config_description: A fixed memory pool size in MB for for SSTable index summaries. If left empty, this will default to 5% of the heap size. If the memory usage of all index summaries exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries in order to meet this limit.  However, this is a best-effort process. In extreme conditions Cassandra may need to use more than this amount of memory.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' is used to set a fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. It is retrieved using DatabaseDescriptor.getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() method and then used to initialize the memory pool size for the index summary manager.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the configuration depends on the memory usage of all index summaries. If the memory usage exceeds the configured limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries to meet the limit. This resizing process is triggered when the memory usage exceeds the configured capacity.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' configuration option is that it limits the memory usage for index summaries. If the memory usage exceeds this limit, SSTables will shrink their index summaries to meet the limit. However, in extreme conditions, Cassandra may need to use more memory than the configured limit.
